title:
Honda Acty with this second-hand Smittybilt Overlander Skycamp Hybox rooftop tent I found that someone just discarded near the Stewart Falls FOB. Itâs got this durable dyneema body and a super 8 MHz MC 68020  precipitation-hardened aluminum-magnesium-silicon alloy that is basically based on the original MC 68000 design. Super useful on super damp, nearly monsoon-y deployments.
Below is this Thonet bentwood furniture made from beechwood, steam-bent and molded to create an awesome Bauhaus stylings, a Thonet B 9 classic sq table with glass top, and the S 411 which is a timeless classis sofa with taffeta accents on these super comfy upholstered cushions.
Upstairs is a 3D hand fitted Tugendhat Bed from some data I downloaded from Crytovoxels in Brno, CZ and good luck getting there these days, so I just got a copy (legit! I have xfer receipts!) and had The Bentwood Bailey in the Glaserstock FOB do the fab.
For electronics and stuff I built around the Panavision Millennium DXL with a Light Iron auto navigator thatâs mostly a DIY mechanical bolt-on that has been way more solid than the stock navigator, the US Robotics Sportster V.34 28.8 which you could never get the firmware update to work right. Simple kitchen by Molteni centered around the MCHS16 16 burner Grand Cuisine, including advanced burner tech for precise temp control, high-performance griddle and grill, and an exceptional ventilation system (and super easy cleaning, cause my crew can get hella messy esp. after long multi-month deployments.)
Hayes AN/PRC-117G multband optical surveillence radio-trinocular for secure comms, and 3M Peltor Tactical 6-S in-ear headsets for all 12 team operators and a L3Harris RA11B Raven for hand-launched ISR.
Chester c/o Baldwin Hills FOB or find me at Abigailâs Road House, RTE 0x419A.

media.title:
John Deere MADIS Mk4 M-ATV postal drone that we used mostly for the Western Basin Rural Postal Delivery Service but can be used for all kinds of autonomous delivery, terrain surveys, geographic, and environmental assay, firmware updates and system migrations, UberEats delivery, etc. Sits on these toothy Nitto Ridge Grabbers on independent four-way Hydroluxe Roland TB-303s. 32 ounce hydroxelene can keeps you going and heated for 8 weeks. 
Can operate in autonomous, deployed, or semi-attended modes although the interior design is quite austere (I did a six week ride-along though and I was fine with a single bed and just a Kenmore ToastMaster toaster oven, but I ate mostly Bela-OlhÃ£o mackerel sandwiches on fresh baked Poujauran that Apollonia PoilÃ¢neâs org HALO drops along my route if I ask nicely.)
Upstairs is a fantastic view esp. when out on the south ranges. You can put the Stressless Consul Recliner on top which is great as itâs a classic with great features, like a patented Glide system that adjusts to your bodyâs movements, and 3M weather resistant upholstery. Otherwise it normally stays in the HuppÃ© entertainment center below, with the NestlÃ© 112â TV on a Nexus 21 L-50 motorized lift, and Onkyo TX-8500MKIII high-powered receiver, Technics RS-B965 cassette deck with auto-reverse, Dolby-B and three-head design.
Like I said, the galley is pretty spare, what with the ToastMaster, a Cuisinart WAF-F20 Double Belgian Waffle Maker, Christofle Malmaison flatware, and Sferra Classico table linens, tablecloths, placemats, and napkins. But itâs easy to make do.

Contact Otto on 107.5 Mhz if youâre in the northeastern sector near Casper, or c/o Rangerâs Field & Feed Supply in Durkee Bluffs. Solid offers only please, or trades for 6th Gen VTOL, thanks!

Waited in line all (cold!) morning at the Throgs Neck Micro Center to get in on this Oshkosh-Jeep Balenciaga Edition Expedition Wagoneer with all the trimmings and I was second from last but then a bunch of people couldnât stay because the 2nd shift started. Took a risk, but I waited and got 1 of 2000 in the drop. So like..hellyeah. 

Itâs got the like-a-rock Oshkosh chassis built on an Amiga 2000 Outland Dynamics engine core that pumps 680 bpm steady-state on one charge, Borden hydrene filtered HVAC system with Rockwell EcoFresh CO2 flush, 16 Razer Titan gamer chairs (4 lay flat), HP-28C console-integrated kinetic navigator, Hunter Douglas & Lutron interior lighting fixtures and sconces, a fully automatic Armalite Classic kitchen with oak veneer finish and double-oven perfect for entertaining. 

Private study on the lower deck done in bold silhouettes, oversized shapes, and unexpected proportions. Because this is for research, I specâd the study around a Agilent Analytic 280FS Atomic Absorption Spectrophotometer, which routes soil excavated by a Minolta AE-1 remote armature (not pictured). Can do 200-300 soil samples per cycle enroute even on solo deploys with the HP-28C managing routes and monitoring where the buoys are dropped. 
Speed Queen laundry, Harvia infrared sauna which is great north of the 52 line. Double bunks with comfy Tuft & Needle mattresses, full Aesop hand-washing stations one on each deck.

Canât wait to take this out at the end of the season. Looking for crew if interested. Contact Spencer c/o Tartine, Bayhead or block 1BvBMSEYstWetqTFn5Au4m4GFg7xJaNVN2 (Base 58) on FedEx.

Rest comes easy in the B&B Fairchild-Italia bunk house that sleeps 8 in delightful doubles adjacent to Delta Faucet steam shower.

Time to let this one go my fav tbh an AMG ATX 640 Peter âSneaky Peteâ Browning Ltd Edition build (this is 31/100) with steel-belted Winston Cortez radials and Minolta AE-1 Beadlock CO4 synthetic carborundum wheels. It has the Trane-ADM XV20i rebreather and a factory installed Fujitsu HVAC digester, 12 sq ft General Mills dry store pantry, Coleman Himalaya camp top that sleeps 6 adults or 8 children or related combinations on these awesome Cluvens articulated lay-flats with built-in Osaki-Panasonic autonomous lower leg and calf massagers, and a Chrysler semi-autonomous 8-way independent k-bar axle drives to all four corners. GE lighting system interior and exterior with 16k color control via a sweet Pentax 1200 USB connected touch panel which also drives the homebrew Sun Microsystems workstation that doubles as the entertainment center.
This build is great for extensive/expansive research expeditions with its ridiculous range and I think it runs best on high pH level Suntory Heliodroxinol Nog, cause I get about 2300 km on one just regular (retail) can and about 10% less than that on anything from Keurig or Borden but I get that you canât always get Suntory rationed depending on your FOBâs quartermaster). Perfect for submersible ops or flood zone passages with its positive floatation index and big, roomy interior and glass bottom view ports (the kids love that of course, but even when on an assay thatâs super useful.)
Has to move quickly as weâre moving on to another FOB right on the edge and at high elevation and they already have an ATX so weâll likely replace with a comparable digger or VTOL to get back to HALO refitting and refactoring work. Contact Rosario c/o Shopsinâs Front Range Griddle or on the S-Band around Essex or 819Mhz after the third shift weekdays.

Freuhauf-Chrysler Landrush 820 with four new Vibram DirtGrabber setups on Bendix 32R GPT wheels with integrated traction management firmware. No-Loop routing algorithm is built in to the course management - you canât get that from the factory anymore, just fyi. Weâve used this for everything from weekend outings to movie night to a regional school bus. The interior is to die for: adjustable Recaroâs with full active restraint and synthetic ride adjustment in all 12 seats, two (2!) 1sqm commodes, dinette that seats 6 at a time, two bunk berths (sleeps 4 super comfy), stowage for about 6 standard overhead-sized bags plus a hard locker for valuables, armaments, and food grade cold storage. Can support about 36 sqm of Drydro whichâll give you 2000km out-and-back range (1000km to bingo.) ICOM SatComs 6200 rig, Rheem RSNM 32 O2 generator and active filtration with 3M integrated GPT q-luft monitoring, and one long 48â Fisher WSI lab bench/workstation. Fully autonomous or thereâs an accessory Roadmaster X56 HOTAS standard stick steering for you manual hands-on nerds. Serious inquiries only please! Thank you! Contact Chester @ Bumperâs Grill Elk Rapids USPS-0x54E12 leave a Veripal secure wrapped message too much intellibot spam lately ð¤¨!

Selling my dadâs old Winnebago Summer Clipper. Yup. Itâs got to go. (Trade?) Everything except the reflow system is original and that includes all the brass couplings, a Thermos refrigerator and IKEA cedar bunks. 127k miles on a Takumseh 83B HydroMesh with a rebuilt Thiokol Trailmaster relief valve. No passenger seat per se but thereâs room for a bolt-on if you want. Small Coleman galley cooker and the Rheem recirculating HVAC keeps the air clean plus dry and the AC probably needs a a reflush. Sperry-Rand comms bay with 2 and 4 meter long wave, ICOM IC-L3520 local team radio with 4 tactical comms rigs. Plenty of gear storage, rebuilt Miele washer-dehydrator with water generator-purifier. About 1200 hours on the hydrogen converter and the same on the power transfer and axles. Will trade for atmospheric converter or decent LTA or VTOL cargo capable transport. That thing was bonkers. A paltry 6 ETH part that was the rarest machine part - and clutch to keeping the multiple quantum entangled adjacent nows that were all necessary to calmly, cooly, collectedly unriddle the encryption packages that came in drops about every minute or two. title:
Chester and Felix figured their cannabis biotech MMORPG start-up failed because they actually graduated from Stanford, not because they spent all of their Series D in a few weeks. 
In a last desperate pivot, they took the blockchain refining mini game from the bigger game and moved it out of their grandfatherâs basement into the last grow house with power. 
That proved prescient.
âI was going to keep that ETH refinery going just for nostalgiaâs sake âÂ and because I honestly didnât know what I was going to do with my life. I mean..I fâing actually *graduated from Stanford. I knew I was screwed, like..forever alwaysâ
Now, they have major, major collabs and sponsors and are dropping tokens like...UHN!
âWe canât even come up with a, you know, valuation, so we just, like..buy their tokens at each drop on a quadratic curveâ, said an a16z spokesperson. âWeâre re-evaluating our rules about only investing in drop-outs..and itâs, you know, because of Chester and Felix.â
And there are other reasons to be thankful they kept the refinery going â the cool war with the $BTC needs more treasury, and go-getters like these guys are doing their part to make the bulwark against the long-awaited flippening fall apart.
A âgood friendâ of the a16z DAO commented in a message on their blockchain: âThe border skirmishes are getting more and more degenerate. The local memetypes and other insurgencies are killing the zeal. They just joke around. Itâs so annoying. Weâre trying to do something real here, and the weird $INSCRUTABLES and $SHIB factions and donât get me started with the $DOGE. I mean, itâs not a joke anymore. Is it? No. I donât think so. I donât care if youâre a 12 year old community management prodigy with 3.5MM Roblox friends, weâre fighting for survival so stop horsing around.â
